description:
About

This job is located in Indianola MS

Are you fascinated by the workings of vehicles and take pride in ensuring they perform at their best? If you possess a keen mechanical aptitude and a penchant for problem-solving, this role could be perfect for you. Embrace the opportunity to maintain and improve a diverse fleet, keeping operations smooth and efficient.

As aFleet Mechanic , your expertise will play a pivotal role in maintaining the reliability and safety of our vehicles. You'll be entrusted with the responsibility of conducting routine inspections and troubleshooting mechanical issues, ensuring preventive maintenance, and executing essential repair tasks. Imagine the satisfaction of knowing each vehicle you work on is operating optimally because of your skills and dedication.
• Perform comprehensive diagnostics to identify mechanical issues.
• Execute repairs and maintenance on engines, hydraulic systems, brake systems, and more.
• Accurately document work performed and parts used.
• Collaborate effectively with team members to ensure high industry standards.
• Stay updated with advancements in automotive technology and tools.

Our ideal candidate is diligent, detail-oriented, and passionate about making a technical impact. Showcasingexcellent problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset,you will thrive in a dynamic environment. You demonstrate strong communication abilities, working seamlessly within a team while also taking the initiative to solve issues independently.

Why join us? Enjoy a supportive work environment that values your growth and contributions. Revel in the professional satisfaction that comes with a career in which every day presents new challenges and opportunities for learning.

Are you ready to make a tangible difference? We encourage enthusiastic and skilled individuals like you to apply. Take the next step in your career and join a team where your expertise will be highly valued.

Nice-to-have skills
• Diagnostics
• Indianola, Iowa, United States

Work experience
• Electronics Engineering

Languages
• English

description:
Atlantic Specialty Care, a 90-bed long-term care skilled nursing community located in Atlantic, IA, is now hiring!

Admissions Coordinator (RN Required)

Location: Atlantic Specialty Care – Atlantic, IA

Atlantic Specialty Care, part of the Care Initiatives network, is seeking a compassionate and motivated Admissions Coordinator (RN) to join our team. In this key role, you will support individuals and families during one of the most important transitions of their healthcare journey. Our mission is to deliver exceptional care and support throughout the entire continuum of long-term care.

An active Registered Nurse (RN) license is required for this position.

Why Join Care Initiatives?
• Competitive Pay: We offer an extremely competitive wage.
• Comprehensive Benefits: Eligible team members have access to affordable medical, dental, vision, retirement savings, PTO, and more.
• Referral Bonus Program: Receive extra income for referring great candidates.
• Dayforce Wallet: Access your earned wages before payday.

Key Responsibilities
• Serve as the primary point of contact for new admissions and coordinate the admission process.
• Review referrals and assess for clinical appropriateness.
• Maintain positive relationships with hospitals, case managers, families, and internal care teams.
• Ensure compliance with federal and state regulations related to long-term care admissions.
• Support census growth through outreach and relationship-building within the community.

Qualifications
• Must hold a valid RN license in the state of Iowa.
• Prior experience in skilled nursing, admissions, marketing, or case management preferred.
• Strong communication, organizational, and customer service skills.
• Ability to handle confidential information with professionalism and discretion.

Take the next step in your healthcare career with Care Initiatives. Apply today to make a meaningful impact at Atlantic Specialty Care.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, Care Initiatives will honor your experiences, perspectives, and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable, and welcoming.

Care Initiatives is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. Care Initiatives complies with applicable federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, parental status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
Already a Kwik Trip Coworker? Follow this link to apply: myapps.kwiktrip.com
Location: Kwik Star 1213
Pay Range: $17.00 to $22.99
Shift: Variable

Actual pay will be based on various factors, such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, proficiency for the role, and internal equity. In addition to base pay, Kwik Trip gives 40% of pre-tax profits back to our coworkers with bonuses ranging from 8-12% of each coworker’s gross annual wage depending on company profitability and offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, 401k, paid time off, and more.

Assistant Food Manager

Kwik Trip is seeking energetic, outgoing, and positive people to make a difference in the communities we serve. Our Assistant Food Managers are responsible for our food program. They prepare foods, delegate tasks, train coworkers, resolve customer complaints, set the example for excellent customer service, ensure the team focuses on achieving daily goals, assist with merchandising, and most importantly ensure that the highest quality of customer service is being met on a daily basis

Requirements:

· Great people skills

· Enjoy a fast paced work environment

· Ability to problem solve challenges and shift priorities quickly

· Desire to help others

· Maintain a clean and inviting store

· 6 months food experience including customer service and food prep

· Ability to get others motivated to complete tasks and meet goals

· Knowledgeable on food safety and sanitation

· Lift up to 50lbs, walk/stand up to 8-10 hours per day

· Available to work full-time (40 hours per week) primarily 2nd shift

Kwik Trip has rated as a Top Workplace several years running, both nationally and in the states that we operate. We live by our mission, treating others how we would like to be treated and we strive to make a difference in people's lives. Our mission drives how we operate as a business as well as how we approach staffing our stores. We are a family owned company and share 40% of pre-tax profits with all their coworkers. Our teams are loaded with fun, ambitious and energetic people that make work enjoyable and brighten the days of our guests.

Kwik Trip is an innovative company that offers a variety of careers paths, from Retail Leadership to our Support Center and Production and Distribution Facilities. Many Assistant Food Managers throughout the company have developed the skills to take on new challenges and other leadership roles within the company.

Kwik Trip, Inc. is a family-owned, Midwest company, in operation since 1965. We are dedicated to serving our guests and coworkers while treating everyone like family. Along with our award-winning culture, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Learn more about Kwik Trip and our culture.
Learn more about....

job_title: SALES ASSOCIATE in MARION, IA S07226
description:
Work Where You Matter

At Dollar General, our mission is Serving Others! We value each and every one of our employees. Whether you are looking to launch a new career in one of our many convenient Store locations, Distribution Centers, Store Support Center or with our Private Fleet Team, we are proud to provide a wide range of career opportunities. We are not just a retail company; we are a company that values the unique strengths and perspectives that each individual brings. Your difference truly makes a difference at Dollar General. How would you like to Serve? Join the Dollar General Journey and see how your career can thrive.
Company Overview

Dollar General Corporation has been delivering value to shoppers for more than 80 years. Dollar General helps shoppers Save time. Save money. Every day.® by offering products that are frequently used and replenished, such as food, snacks, health and beauty aids, cleaning supplies, basic apparel, housewares and seasonal items at everyday low prices in convenient neighborhood locations. Learn more about Dollar General at www.dollargeneral.com/about-us.html.

Job Details

GENERAL SUMMARY:

The Sales Associate acts as a point of contact for our customers. The duties of the Sales Associate include assisting customers in locating and purchasing merchandise, operating the cash register, stocking merchandise, recovering merchandise, cleaning the store, and performing other duties as assigned by the Store Manager to maximize store profitability and customer satisfaction while protecting company assets.

DUTIES and ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
• Provide excellent customer service, greet and assist customers.
• Operate cash register and scanner to itemize and total customer’s purchase, collect payment from customers and make change, bag merchandise, and assist customers with merchandise as necessary.
• Follow company merchandise processes; unpack, stock, restock, and rotate merchandise on shelves and build merchandise displays.
• Clean the store, take out trash, dust and mop store floors, clean restroom and receiving room, and help set up sidewalk displays.

Qualifications

KNOWLEDGE and SKILLS:
• Effective interpersonal and oral communication skills.
• Understanding of safety policies and practices.
• Ability to read and follow planogram and merchandise presentation guides.
• Knowledge of basic cash handling procedures.
• Basic mathematical skills.
• Ability to perform cash register functions.
• Ability to stock merchandise.

WORK EXPERIENCE and/or EDUCATION:

High school diploma or equivalent preferred.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
• Frequent walking and standing
• Frequent bending, stooping, and kneeling to run check out station, stock merchandise and unload trucks; which may also require the ability to push and/or pull rolltainers for stocking merchandise
• Frequent handling of merchandise and equipment such as handheld scanners, pricing guns, box cutters, merchandise containers, two-wheel dollies, U-boats (six-wheel carts), and rolltainers
• Frequent and proper lifting of up to 40 pounds; occasional lifting of up to 55 pounds
• Occasional climbing (using step ladder) up to heights of six feet
• Fast-paced environment; moderate noise level
• Occasional exposure to outside weather conditions

Dollar General Corporation is an equal opportunity employer.

job_title: Ottumwa, IA – Garden Center Sales Associate
description:
Earl May Garden Center is looking for an associate manager / sales associate for our location in Ottumwa, Iowa.

Part-time employment may lead to a full-time opportunity.

The Ideal Candidate Will
• have high energy and a positive attitude
• have excellent interpersonal skills
• be a self-starter
• have a strong work ethic
• have strong decision-making and leadership skills
• be sales-driven
• have previous experience working in a retail or service environment
• be able to lift 50 pounds
• be able to work variable hours/shifts
• have a valid driver's license
• Horticulture knowledge or landscape experience is a plus, but we will train if needed.

Previous management, sales and landscape design experience are a definite plus for full time positions.

Full time positions include competitive pay and benefits package. Benefits include health, dental and vision insurance; a 401k plan, employee discount and paid time off.

Apply online by clicking the Apply for Job button below, or apply in person at the Earl May Garden Center at 2857 N Court St, Ottumwa, IA 52501.

description:
Description

Job Overview

Shive-Hattery has an immediate opening in our Bettendorf, IA office for a Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing BIM Manager. This on-site position could also be fulfilled at the following office locations: Iowa City, IA; Cedar Rapids, IA; Des Moines, IA; Chicago, IL; Valparaiso, IN; and Madison, WI.

Our MEP BIM Manager oversees the Building Information Modeling (BIM) process for MEP systems (Revit) within a diverse book of projects. This role involves managing the company's BIM assets and leading improvements to company-wide MEP content and processes. Leading and working collaboratively with mechanical and electrical designers and company BIM Coordinators who ensure systems are aligned, clash-free, and efficiently designed to meet project requirements is key for this position.

Your leadership efforts will target improving project delivery and the client experience:
• Lead Mechanical and Electrical teams to identify development needs for BIM software
• Educate and train Mechanical and Electrical design office BIM Coordinators and lead the implementation of updated workflows
• Provide consistency across offices as a resource in the use of design technologies
• Monitor trade related publications to identify emerging technologies that may impact how Shive-Hattery delivers projects and develop strategies to implement
• Facilitate ongoing development of the company Revit start-up file
• Create and manage new and existing BIM content
• Promote one firm approach by encouraging BIM standards
• Regularly travel to our design offices

Why Shive-Hattery?

You will find the right balance at Shive-Hattery. A large pool of resources in a 500+ person design firm, with a small firm feel where you build personal connections with colleagues, partners and clients. Flourish as a professional with the freedom to chart your own course and make an impact – and Design What Matters to make the world a better place.

At Shive-Hattery, our learning and teaching culture is built on collaboration. You’ll have the opportunity to both learn from and teach your peers, working across disciplines to enhance your skills and grow professionally.

We offer a competitive total compensation package, including industry-leading pay and over thirty-five benefits designed to support your well-being and career development.

Benefit Highlights:
• Medical, Dental, Vision – 4 tiers of coverage
• Voluntary Life Insurance – Employee, Spouse, and Child
• Voluntary Insurance Plans – Accident, Critical Illness, & Hospital Indemnity
• FSA – Medical & Dependent Care
• 8 Paid Holidays + PTO
• Paid Parental Leave
• 401K/Roth 401K with Company Match
• Overtime Bonus
• Profit Sharing Bonus
• First Time License Bonus
• Tuition Reimbursement & Licensure/Certification Financial Support
• Professional Development Opportunities
• Calm Meditation & Stress Relief Subscription
• …And Many More!
Shive-Hattery offers a flexible work environment and supports balancing personal and professional responsibilities. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

description:
ABOUT MORTENSON

As a top builder, developer, and EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction), our expertise spans markets like sports, renewable energy, data centers, healthcare, and more. We are builders at heart, working to ensure the built environment has a lasting positive impact. 

Let’s Redefine Possible® 

Project Name: Shenandoah Wind Project
Project Location: Shenandoah, IA 51601

PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF POSITION

Responsible for the preparation, handling, and supplying of materials to be used by other crafts.

SUMMARY OF EXPECTED OUTCOMES

-High quality, professional work product performed with initiative, productivity, a positive attitude and behavior

-Performance should meet or exceed the established standards, goals, and accountabilities of the position

RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

-Loading and unloading equipment

-Erect and dismantle scaffolding (5X7X16) and staging

-Level ground for scaffolding

-Tend mortar and grout

-Lift, unload, move, set, shovel mortar and grout between wheel barrows and buckets

-General cleanup and clearing of debris, including sweeping, cleaning, washing, and unloading or burning debris

-Placing, pushing, pulling and shoveling concrete

-Vibrating concrete

-All other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS AND KEY SKILL REQUIREMENTS

-Ability to work with tools and equipment such as, power and non-powered hand tools, vibrators, pumps, drills and jackhammers, forklifts, skid loaders and power buggy’s

-Strong teamwork orientation

-Positive attitude and professional customer service skills

-Detail oriented

-Open to change based on diverse input and feedback

-Effectively work with those of diverse backgrounds and organizational levels

-Adaptive, effective communication and active listening skills

-Strong cross-cultural relationship building and influencing at all organizational levels

-Repetitive hand, arm, leg movements

-Lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling: up to 50 lbs

-Lifting, carrying, pushing, or pulling over 50 lbs will be done with assistance of another team member or equipment

This position description is not intended to be a comprehensive list of the duties and responsibilities of the position. The duties and responsibilities of this position may change without notice.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

Experience in construction preferred but not required

Visa sponsorship is not offered for this position

Mortenson is an EOE/Affirmative Action/M/F/Veteran/Disabled employer

Join us at Mortenson and be part of a team that’s building a better future. Apply today!

job_title: Seed Warehouse and Delivery Coordinator - New Century FS - Hartley, IA
description:
PURPOSE AND SUMMARY STATEMENT

Performs operational duties such as seed delivery, seed inventory control, housekeeping, repairs and customer service at assigned location.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Manage inventory, protect from damage and ensure proper paperwork documenting movement in and out of warehouse.

Complete monthly physical inventory and weekly spot checks; communicates product to be ordered.

Monitor inventory for current seasonal and daily needs.

Maintain service/repair records for all equipment including vehicles.

Inform Seed Department Manager of need for major building and equipment repairs and recommend annual fixed asset purchases.

Responsible for the housekeeping of warehouse(s) and surrounding grounds at assigned location(s).

Keep vehicles and equipment clean, parked neatly and security checked daily.

Ensure that employees follow all safety procedures, including use of personal protective equipment.

Report any unsafe equipment or procedure to the supervisor.

Remove rainwater or spilled product from load pads and dike areas and dispose of as directed.

(redundant)

Assist in loading and unloading bulk seed and container products for pickup or delivery.

Retrieve product from other suppliers or company locations.

Delivers product to customers and rotates according to date.

Report any possible product problems at customer locations and provide outstanding customer service.

Maintain product handling equipment and complete needed repairs.

OTHER JOB FUNCTIONS

May be required to do one or more of the following:

Maintain quality control of seed.

Learn the operation of all equipment and vehicles at the location and be available to help in times of peak demand.

Follows GROWMARK’s Code of Conduct and Corporate Compliance Program, Environmental Health and Safety, OSHA and DOT policies and procedures, as they apply.

Performs all other duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS

Normally requires high school diploma and 1-2 years or more of agriculture or warehouse related work experience, or the equivalent thereof, to demonstrate knowledge of inventory control and organization skills.

Must be able to obtain and maintain forklift operation certification, Commercial Driver’s License with Hazmat & Tanker endorsement, Mixer Loader Pesticide Certified & License, as well as maintain a satisfactory driving record.

Ability to lift at least 70 pounds frequently.

Frequently exposed to extreme weather conditions and noisy conditions.

May occasionally be exposed to dust, fumes, chemicals, and electrical hazards with appropriate safety measures.

May occasionally be required to work at varying heights.

Must be able to travel independently and overnight.

Demonstrated essential abilities business knowledge, collaboration, communication, customer focus, decision making and skill development.

Ability and willingness to participate in required training that may include education on GROWMARK’s policies and procedures and additional training as it relates to the requirements of the position.

description:
Job Location: Dubuque IA

Flexible Schedules Available

Summary

The Territory Sales Lead (TSL) ensures flawless execution of store level sales and promotion plans with customer retailers in assigned territory.  The territory consists of high-volume food chain grocers and mass merchandiser customers.  The TSL masters retail execution plans by driving incremental sales, implementing, and maintaining best-in-class promotional and merchandising strategies, and ensuring 100% distribution on authorized Hershey items across all classes of trade. A successful TSL will be driven, entrepreneurial, influential, and planful.
 
Responsibilities

Consultative Business Partnering
Customer Relationship Development and Management: 
• Build and maintain consultative business relationships with customer Key Decision Makers (KDMs) at all levels. 
• Partner and collaborate with KDMs to develop and execute action plans to increase sales. Cultivate a network of influential contacts at all levels of customers to achieve sales objectives.
• Leverage strategic relationships with KDMs to influence and negotiate customers’ assistance in the merchandising of Hershey products.  
 

Data Analysis:
• Obtain and analyze relevant store, product, and market data and leverage trends and analytics to build the business.
• Utilize and complete pre-call planning methods and other company tools.   
• Review and make recommendations to modify routes that maximize business efficiencies for all sales calls within territory. 
• Effectively solve problems by analyzing information, utilizing consumer trends and customer insights to guide decision making and influence others to act.
 

Sales:
• Engage in forward selling via consultative sales techniques using provided data sources, technology, processes and procedures. 
• Maximize sales and display opportunities by conducting store walk-throughs and gaining commitment by KDMs on successful outcomes.   
• Tailor strategies to influence KDMs to order additional products to increase incremental sales and to obtain best in class quality of merchandising locations.

Merchandising
Achieve all merchandising objectives executing customer specific promotional plans to the sales floor using forward selling. Partnership at store level is critical for TSL’s to effectively build, maintain and execute product on the sales floor, in addition to merchandising and maintaining permanent secondary displays and other display vehicles

Administrative Responsibilities
Complete and submit reports of daily and weekly activities, expenses, competitive activity, account changes, promotions and all administrative functions within assigned territory using company approved methods and technology

Qualifications

Education and Experience:
• 2-year Associate/Community College degree required OR 3 years of previous sales experience.
• Bachelor's degree strongly preferred.
 

Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform essential duties/responsibilities, with or without a reasonable accommodation:

• Must have a valid US state issued driver’s license 
• Must reside or be willing to commute within territory boundaries
• Must be able to drive to make multiple sales calls on a daily basis

• Must be able to lift 10-60 lbs. on a regular basis with or without reasonable accommodations
• Must be able to bend, kneel, stoop down and demonstrate manual dexterity on a frequent basis with or without reasonable accommodations

• Occasionally climb ladders

• Occasionally use equipment such as crushing balers, handheld electric trucks
• Must be able to use tablet and other wireless technology; some roles will require an intermediate level of computer skills with the Microsoft Office products
• Must have daily access to wireless internet
• Must have flexibility and adaptability to changes in territory coverage

• Occasional weekend work may be required during peak seasons and select territories may require occasional overnight stays. 

Employees can expect to be paid a starting base salary of $50,000. Additional compensation may include overtime & incentives. Other benefits include health care, vision, dental, retirement, vacation, sick leave.

description:
Sales Tech Specialist - Inteligencia Artificial

Descripción del puesto:¿Eres una persona con experiencia en Venta Consultiva, te apasiona la tecnología y te gustaría ser uno de los protagonistas del proceso de transformación que está llevando a cabo la inteligencia artificial?

Nuestro cliente (contratación directa en cliente e indefinida) despliega soluciones de Análisis predictivo y prescriptivo basadas en Inteligencia Artifical enfocados a procesos complejos de toma de decisiones: modelos predictivos sobre técnicas de machine learning, simulación y, muy especialmente, observabilidad y optimización matemática para elegir la mejor opción posible en entornos de gran complejidad.

Buscamos un perfil para integrarse en el equipo de ventas y ayudarnos a visibilizar y expandir nuestras soluciones.

Requisitos:
• Formación: Grado en ingeniería, matemáticas, tecnología o áreas afines.

description:

Desde Hasten Group, buscamos un / a Ingeniero / a en Inteligencia Artificial con experiencia para liderar el diseño, desarrollo y mantenimiento de soluciones innovadoras basadas en machine learning, deep learning e inteligencia artificial generativa. • Titulación en Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería de Sistemas, Matemáticas, Estadística o campo relacionado.
• Entre 3 y 5 años de experiencia en desarrollo de modelos de IA, machine learning e inteligencia artificial generativa.
• Dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python o R.

• Experiencia en procesamiento y manipulación de datos con herramientas como Pandas, NumPy y SQL.

• Familiaridad con arquitecturas software y despliegue en la nube (AWS, GCP o Azure).
• Conocimiento de servicios de IA y ML de hyperscalers (Amazon SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure Machine Learning, etc.).

• Conocimiento de protocolos de comunicación como REST API o MQTT.

• Habilidades de liderazgo y experiencia en gestión de equipos técnicos.
• Buenas habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipos multidisciplinares.
• Experiencia integrando IA generativa en aplicaciones empresariales.
• Conocimiento y experiencia en metodologías ágiles (Scrum, Kanban).
• Publicaciones o participación activa en la comunidad de IA.

Hasten Group es una consultora en plena expansión, especializada en Transformación Digital y Reclutamiento IT.

Consideramos el trabajo en equipo, la innovación constante y el talento humano como claves para afrontar con éxito los retos de un sector cambiante.

job_title: Estágio em Pesquisa - Mestrandos - Inteligência Artificial
description:
Are you a master's student in the field of Artificial Intelligence looking to gain hands-on experience in cutting-edge research? Look no further! IBM is seeking highly motivated and talented individuals to join our team as a Research Intern in Artificial Intelligence. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work alongside top researchers, using your skills and knowledge to tackle complex problems and drive innovation. If you are passionate about AI and eager to learn from the best, we want you on our team.
Conduct research on various topics related to Artificial Intelligence under the guidance of experienced researchers
Collaborate with team members to develop innovative solutions for complex problems in the field of AI
Utilize your knowledge and skills in AI to contribute to ongoing projects and experiments
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements and breakthroughs in the field of AI and incorporate them into research projects
Analyze data and findings, and present them in a clear and concise manner to the team and other stakeholders
Participate in team meetings and discussions to share ideas and provide valuable insights
Take ownership of assigned tasks and projects, and ensure timely and high-quality delivery
Assist in the development and implementation of AI models and algorithms
Continuously learn and improve your skills through hands-on experience and mentorship from experienced researchers
Adhere to ethical standards and guidelines while conducting research and handling sensitive data
Represent IBM and the research team in a professional and positive manner at all times.

IBM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

job_title: Training Coach – Formación en Inteligencia Artificial
description:

Formación o experiencia en el ámbito tecnológico.
Excelentes habilidades comunicativas y de presentación.
Interés y conocimientos básicos en herramientas de inteligencia artificial.

Experiencia previa como formador/a o en entornos educativos.

Profesionales del ámbito docente con interés en la tecnología.
Ingenieros/as o perfiles técnicos con vocación formativa.

Tags

Training, Trainer, Formación, IA, Artificial Intelligence, Microsoft 365, LMS, KPI, Live Sessions

¿Por qué NTT DATA?

Porque creemos en el talento como motor de cambio. En NTT DATA te ofrecemos un entorno flexible, dinámico y global donde podrás desarrollarte profesionalmente, aprender cada día y marcar la diferencia.

¡Queremos conocerte!

job_title: 🧠 Buscamos Especialista en Automatización e Inteligencia Artificial - Contract to Hire
description:
Estamos buscando un freelancer con experiencia práctica en automatización de procesos usando Make y n8n, además de conocimientos en desarrollo de chatbots y asistentes virtuales.

Colaboramos con pequeñas empresas que necesitan optimizar tareas repetitivas y atención al cliente mediante soluciones inteligentes.

⸻

Tareas:

• Diseñar flujos automáticos en Make y n8n.

• Conectar herramientas como CRMs, hojas de cálculo o Notion.

• Crear asistentes virtuales conversacionales.

• Conectar con APIs.

• Documentar lo creado para facilitar su uso y ajustes.

¿Qué necesitamos para valorar tu propuesta?

• Ejemplos de proyectos similares.

• Herramientas que conoces bien.

• Disponibilidad actual.

• Tarifa o forma de trabajo preferida.

¿Te gusta vender soluciones de IA innovadoras? Únete a Intalva.
• SOBRE NOSOTROS*

Intalva desarrolla asistentes virtuales y soluciones de voz con inteligencia artificial para empresas.

Automatizamos tareas como la gestión de citas, envío de documentos y atención telefónica.

Nuestra tecnología combina voz, WhatsApp y APIs para transformar la productividad sin complicaciones.

Con Intalva, las empresas pueden:
• Enviar documentos por teléfono de forma segura (Docu Flow),
• Automatizar agendas, citas, pedidos y llamadas (Agenda IA),
• Y preguntar a su base de datos o documentos con lenguaje natural (Smart Pal)
• QUÉ BUSCAMOS*

Buscamos asesores comerciales autónomos (freelance) para ofrecer nuestros productos de voz e inteligencia artificial a empresas de todo tipo: asesorías, despachos, clínicas, restaurantes, negocios con CRM, inventario, citas o atención al cliente.
• Buscamos asesores comerciales autónomos en activo (freelance), con experiencia demostrada en venta de servicios, preferiblemente acostumbrado a la venta a puerta fría o por contacto directo.
• Que dispongan de una cartera de clientes activa o contactos en sectores como asesorías, despachos profesionales, clínicas, comercios o pymes.
• Que estén acostumbrado a trabajar por objetivos y se sientan cómodos operando a comisión, con autonomía total y altas posibilidades de ingresos.
• Que valoren la innovación y no tengan miedo de ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas (aunque no se requiere experiencia en IA o software; se proporciona formación completa).
• QUÉ OFRECEMOS*
• Altas comisiones
• Incentivos con ingresos escalables según objetivos alcanzados
• Formación completa en productos, herramientas y técnicas de venta.
• Material comercial actualizado para facilitar la captación de clientes.
• Soporte continuo, tanto técnico como comercial.
• Libertad total de zona: trabaja desde donde quieras, sin exclusividades ni restricciones geográficas.
• Autonomía total: tú gestionas tu tiempo y tu cartera de clientes.

Si tienes contactos en empresas o asesorías, y te gusta la tecnología, este proyecto es para ti.

job_title: Expertise em Programa/o para Treinamento de Modelos de IA
description:
A Outlier ajuda as empresas mais inovadoras do mundo a melhorar seus modelos de inteligência artificial, fornecendo feedback humano. Você é um engenheiro de software experiente que gostaria de usar sua expertise em programação para treinar modelos de IA?

Trabalhamos em parceria com organizações para treinar grandes modelos de linguagem de IA, ajudando modelos generativos avançados a escrever códigos melhores. Os projetos geralmente incluem problemas discretos e altamente variados, que envolvem a interação com esses modelos enquanto aprendem a programar. Não é necessária experiência prévia em IA.

Sobre a oportunidade:

A Outlier está em busca de programadores talentosos para ajudar a treinar modelos de inteligência artificial generativa.
Essa oportunidade freelance é completamente remota, com horários flexíveis, permitindo que você trabalhe nos momentos que forem mais convenientes para você.

Você pode contribuir com sua experiência ao:
• Criar e responder a perguntas relacionadas à ciência da computação para ajudar no treinamento de modelos de IA.
• Avaliar e classificar os códigos gerados por modelos de IA.

Exemplos de expertise desejada:
• Estar atualmente matriculado ou ter concluído um bacharelado ou grau superior em ciência da computação em uma instituição renomada.
• Proficiência em uma ou mais das seguintes linguagens de programação: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, Verilog.
• Grande atenção aos detalhes, incluindo gramática, pontuação e diretrizes de estilo.

Pagamento:
• Atualmente, as taxas de pagamento para o trabalho principal realizado por especialistas em programação variam entre $16 e $33 USD por hora.
• As taxas podem variar de acordo com a expertise, avaliação de habilidades, localização, necessidades do projeto e outros fatores. Por exemplo, taxas mais altas podem ser oferecidas a candidatos com doutorado. Para trabalhos não principais, como durante a integração inicial ao projeto ou fases extras, podem ser aplicadas taxas menores. Alguns projetos também oferecem pagamentos de incentivo. Consulte os termos de pagamento de cada projeto.

PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

job_title: Senior Solution Architect AI/ML , AGS Brazil Specialist SAs
description:
Você é apaixonado por ajudar clientes a construir soluções utilizando ferramentas de Inteligência Artificial, Machine Learning e Deep Learning de ú
ltima geração na Amazon Web Services (AWS)? Gostaria de se concentrar no desenvolvimento de sistemas de IA agênticos para nossos clientes no Brasil? Venha se juntar a nós!

Na Amazon, investimos profundamente em inteligência artificial por mais de 20 anos, e muitas das capacidades que os clientes experimentam em nossos produtos são impulsionadas por machine learning.

A AWS está procurando um Arquiteto de Soluções de Inteligência Artificial/Machine Learning (AI/ML SA), para se juntar aos nossos outros Especialistas (SMEs) ajudando clientes a projetar soluções que aproveitam nossos serviços de GenAI, incluindo Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker e Amazon Q. Como parte da equipe, você trabalhará diretamente com clientes para viabilizar casos de uso em larga escala, projetar pipelines de GenAI, construir sistemas agênticos e impulsionar a adoção da AWS para plataformas de AI/ML. Você interagirá com outros SAs no campo, fornecendo orientação em seus engajamentos com clientes, e desenvolverá white papers, blogs, implementações de referência e apresentações para permitir que os clientes aproveitem totalmente a GenAI na AWS. Além disso, como a voz do cliente, você trabalhará em estreita colaboração com as equipes de serviço e enviará solicitações de recursos de produtos para impulsionar a plataforma.

A AWS Global Sales impulsiona a adoção da nuvem AWS em todo o mundo, permitindo que clientes de todos os tamanhos inovem e se expandam na nuvem. Nossa equipe capacita cada cliente a crescer, fornecendo serviço ersonalizado, tecnologia incomparável e suporte inabalável. Mergulhamos profundamente para entender os desafios únicos de cada cliente e, em seguida, criamos soluções inovadoras que aceleram seu sucesso. Essa abordagem centrada no cliente é como construímos a nuvem mais adotada do mundo. Junte-se a nós e nos ajude a crescer.

A AWS Sales, Marketing e Global Services (SMGS) é responsável por impulsionar receita, adoção e crescimento das contas de pequeno e médio porte maiores e de crescimento mais rápido até clientes de nível empresarial, incluindo o setor público.

Key job responsibilities
A equipe de Especialistas em IA/ML Brasil constrói relações técnicas com clientes de todos os tamanhos e atua como seu consultor de confiança, garantindo que eles obtenham o máximo da nuvem em cada etapa de sua jornada enquanto adotam Machine Learning em toda a sua organização.

Você gerenciará o relacionamento técnico geral entre a AWS e nossos clientes, fazendo recomendações sobre segurança, custo, desempenho, confiabilidade e eficiência operacional para acelerar seus desafiadores projetos de Machine Learning.

Internamente, você será a voz do cliente, compartilhando suas necessidades em relação ao uso de nossos serviços, impactando o roadmap de recursos de IA/ML da AWS.

Nesta função, sua criatividade conectará tecnologia a soluções tangíveis, com a oportunidade de construir agentes de IA para uma variedade de casos de uso.

Você participará da criação e compartilhamento de melhores práticas, conteúdo técnico e novas arquiteturas de referência (por exemplo, white papers, amostras decódigo, posts de blog) e evangelizará e educará sobre a execução de cargas de trabalho de Machine Learning na tecnologia AWS (por exemplo, através de workshops, grupos de usuários, meetups, palestras públicas, vídeos online ou conferências).

Se você deseja educar os clientes da AWS sobre a arte do possível, enquanto desafia o impossível, venha construir o futuro conosco.

A day in the life
A Amazon valoriza experiências diversas. Mesmo que você não atenda a todas as qualificações e habilidades preferidas listadas na descrição da vaga,
incentivamos os candidatos a se candidatarem. Se sua carreira está apenas começando, não seguiu um caminho tradicional ou inclui experiências alternativas, não deixe que isso o impeça de se candidatar.

About the team
Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

- 3+ years of design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures experience
- 8+ years of specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics) experience
- 10+ years of IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries experience

job_title: Analista Funcional Técnico especializado en soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial (IA) y Modelos de
description:
Soltel group está en pleno crecimiento y deseamos incorporar a nuestro equipo un perfil de Analista de Sistemas en remoto con conocimientos en modelos de lenguaje (LLMs) y arquitecturas cloud para unirse a nuestro equipo.
Funciones principales: Análisis funcional y técnico de soluciones basadas en IA y modelos de lenguaje. Captura y gestión de requisitos con cliente final. Elaboración de documentación funcional y técnica: casos de uso, historias de usuario, diagramas, etc. Evaluación de la viabilidad técnica de despliegues on-premise y en cloud. Colaboración directa con equipos de desarrollo y arquitectura.
Requisitos técnicos: Inteligencia Artificial y LLMs Conocimiento funcional de LLMs: ciclo de vida (entrenamiento, fine-tuning, inferencia) y casos de uso. Familiaridad con arquitecturas de despliegue on-premise y cloud (LLaMA, Mistral, Gemma, GPT open-source). Conocimiento básico del funcionamiento de transformers y embeddings. MLOps y herramientas Entendimiento de pipelines MLOps y herramientas como MLflow, Weights & Biases o Hugging Face Hub. Nociones básicas de Python orientado a IA (no es necesario programar). Experiencia con herramientas de modelado (UML, BPMN, etc.). Cloud, Seguridad y DevOps Experiencia en entornos cloud (Azure, AWS o GCP), especialmente aplicados a IA generativa o sistemas de datos. Conocimientos en contenedores (Docker) y orquestación con Kubernetes. Familiaridad con sistemas de autenticación y control de acceso (OAuth2, Keycloak, LDAP). Conocimiento básico de Git, CI/CD, APIs REST, JSON, Swagger, Postman. Metodologías de trabajo Conocimiento práctico de Scrum/Kanban y herramientas como Jira, Confluence. Capacidad para traducir necesidades de negocio en requerimientos técnicos. Se valorará: Iniciativa, proactividad y orientación al detalle. Buenas dotes comunicativas para trabajar con distintos perfiles técnicos y de negocio. ¿Qué ofrecemos? Incorporación a proyectos innovadores con IA y tecnologías emergentes. Desarrollo profesional y formación continua.
Entorno de trabajo colaborativo y dinámico. ¿Te interesa? ¡Queremos conocerte!

Perfil de Engenheiro de IA

Somos uma equipe inovadora que constrói soluções escaláveis para o mercado de IA Generativa. Nossa missão é transformar a maneira como gerenciamos, construímos, monitoramos e testamos agentes de IA e modelos em geral.

Ao se juntar à nossa equipe, você terá a chance de influenciar tecnicamente nosso time e enfrentar desafios novos no mercado de IA Generativa.

Desafios que você encontrará por aqui:
• Construir soluções escaláveis que atendam às demandas do mercado de IA Generativa.
• Resolver desafios complexos relacionados à qualidade e resiliência de sistemas de IA.
• Construir sistemas multi-agentes que atuem de forma colaborativa e eficiente.

Qualidades necessárias:
• Conhecimento prático em microserviços e mensageria.
• Experiência em NodeJS; Python e C# são diferenciais.
• Familiaridade com LLM e SLM, incluindo frameworks como LangChain e outros.
• Experiência com bancos de dados não relacionais, como MongoDB e Redis.

Diferenciais:
• Conhecimentos em C#, Python e frameworks como LangChain ou LangGraph.
• Experiência prévia em projetos de IA Generativa.

job_title: 18/6/2025 Aplicante Experto En Inteligencia Artificial Generativa
description:
Desarrolla tu carrera profesional con nosotrosSomos un banco universal, cercano y abierto, que impulsa la rentabilidad de forma sostenida y construye capacidades que garanticen nuestro futuro con foco en la innovación, la transformación digital y el desarrollo sostenible. Con una sólida trayectoria en España y más de 5.000 profesionales, somos el sexto mayor banco del país por capitalización bursátil.Forma parte de nuestro proyecto:
Apostamos por la especialización, el talento y la colaboración con los principales partners tecnológicos.Queremos sumar a nuestro Hub de Inteligencia Artificial Generativa (IAG) un/a Gestor/a Experto/a en Coordinación de Proyectos IAG apasionado/a por la innovación y la transformación digital.Tu rol dentro de UnicajaSerás parte de un entorno multidisciplinar, innovador y con impacto real en el sector a través de la tecnología. Tendrás la misión liderar la planificación, ejecución y escalado de proyectos de IAG, garantizando el cumplimiento de objetivos, la entrega de resultados en tiempo y forma, y la alineación con las necesidades estratégicas de la entidad.En aquello en lo que pondrás foco:
1. Definir y Certificar la viabilidad de los planes de escalado, asegurando su alineación con frameworks y estrategias de innovación.2. Ayudar a configurar los equipos de escalado en coordinación con el responsable del Hub de Desarrollo y Escalado.3. Brindar soporte al desarrollo y escalado de nuevos Sistemas IAG (asegurar que estén alineados con los marcos de trabajo, planes de estabilización, mantenimiento y vigilancia, etc).4. Solicitar al comité de transformación el paso a producción de un nuevo sistema IAG.5. Consolidar la visión global del Plan IAG (inversiones, valor entregado, riesgos, adopción, capacidades).6. Coordinar el mantenimiento y evolución de los marcos de trabajo con las lecciones aprendidas.7. Transferir conocimientos técnicos y funcionales de lo que se está escalando o va a escalado en la organización.Lo que buscamos:
Experiencia en gestión de proyectos tecnológicos de Machine Learning tradicional, experiencia en la Gestión de proyectos tecnológicos de IAG. Formación académica en Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería de Software, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones o áreas afines. Además, es necesario que seas proactivo, resolutivo y con orientación a resultados.BeneficiosUn entorno de trabajo dinámico donde podrás aprender y crecer profesionalmente. Oficinas ubicadas en Málaga. Flexibilidad y bienestar:
jornada intensiva todo el año y horario y condiciones flexibles para que puedas equilibrar tu vida personal y profesional. Paquete retributivo competitivo, beneficios sociales y beneficios exclusivos por pertenecer a Unicaja.

job_title: Especialista en Inteligencia Artificial y Datos
description:

En nuestra unidad de consultoría están buscando un/a experto en inteligencia artificial y datos para liderar soluciones innovadoras.

Buscamos a alguien con capacidad de diseño, liderazgo tecnológico y experiencia en interlocución con clientes.

job_title: Ingeniero de Sistemas de Inteligencia Artificial
description:
Desarrollador de Plataformas de Inteligencia Artificial

Nuestra empresa busca un profesional con habilidades técnicas y experiencia en la implementación y el monitoreo de soluciones de Machine Learning en producción. El objetivo es proporcionar la infraestructura y plataforma vital para respaldar la implementación y el monitoreo de soluciones de ML en producción, así como optimizar soluciones para el rendimiento y escalabilidad.

Responsabilidades:
• Proporcionar la infraestructura y plataforma vitales para respaldar la implementación y el monitoreo de soluciones de Machine Learning en producción.
• Optimizar soluciones para el rendimiento y escalabilidad.
• Colaborar estrechamente con equipos de ciencia de datos en el desarrollo de entornos de IA/ML y flujos de trabajo de ciencia de datos de vanguardia en AWS.
• Servir de enlace con científicos de datos de investigación y desarrollo para comprender sus desafíos y trabajar con ellos para ayudar a producir canalizaciones de Machine Learning, modelos y algoritmos para una ciencia innovadora.
• Asumir la responsabilidad de todos los aspectos de la ingeniería de software, desde el diseño hasta la implementación, el control de calidad y el mantenimiento.
• Liderar procesos tecnológicos desde el desarrollo del concepto hasta la finalización de los entregables del proyecto.
• Colaborar con otros equipos para mejorar nuestra pila tecnológica, para permitir la adopción de los últimos avances en procesamiento de datos e inteligencia artificial.
• Reclutamiento de equipos, impartición de formación y coaching.

Requisitos:
• Experiencia significativa con entornos en la nube de AWS.
• Conocimiento de SageMaker, Athena, S3, EC2, RDS, Glue, Lambda, funciones Step, EKS y ECS.
• Uso de las mejores cadenas de herramientas de DevOps, como Docker y Git.
• Experiencia con infraestructura como código como Ansible, Terraform y Cloud Formation.
• Sólidas habilidades de codificación de software, con dominio de Python.
• Experiencia con contenedores y arquitecturas de microservicios, por ejemplo, Kubernetes, Docker y enfoques sin servidor.
• Experiencia con integración continua y creación de canalizaciones de entrega continua, como CodePipeline, CodeBuild y Code Deploy.
• Experiencia en GxP.

Beneficios:
• Esquema 100% nominal.
• Prestaciones de Ley.
• Vales de despensa.
• Beneficios adicionales.
• Programa Bienestar.
• Plan de Desarrollo Profesional.

Otras ventajas:

Colaboración multicultural y oportunidades de crecimiento profesional en un ambiente de trabajo dinámico y apasionado.

job_title: Profesor para clases particulares de informática para inteligencia artificial, diseño gráfico, programación
description:
Quiero saber cuanto me costarían clases particulares de ejecución de python y otros y de inteligencia artificial.
• Tipo de clases Clases individuales
• ¿El estudiante es un niño o adulto? Adulto(a)
• ¿Cuál es el nivel que tienes con el manejo de ordenadores? Medio
• ¿En qué se necesita ayuda? Inteligencia artificial, diseño gráfico (photoshop o similar), programación
• Lugar(es) de preferencia para realizar las clases A domicilio, en el domicilio del profesor
• ¿Cuándo quieres empezar las clases? Dentro de 1 mes o más
• Frecuencia deseada de las clases Semanal (una o más veces a la semana)
• Horario(s) de preferencia para las clases Entre semana por las mañanas, entre semana por las tardes

Preferencia para el servicio: Relación calidad/precio

GFT es una compania pionera en transformacion digital que desarrolla soluciones sostenibles basadas en nuevas tecnologias, como la inteligencia artificial y blockchain/DLT. Los expertos de GFT crean e implementan aplicaciones de software escalables que hacen que el acceso a modelos de negocio innovadores sea seguro y sencillo.

Que estamos buscando?

Actualmente tenemos un puesto vacante para un/a GO Developer que quiera desarollar su carrera en GFT. Buscamos una persona entusiasta y dinamica dispuesta a empezar y crecer en un entorno multicultural, retador y motivante.

Tus principales responsabilidades son:

Aunque dependeran de tu perfil y experiencia aportada, en general las principales funciones que llevarias a cabo con nosotros serian:
• Evolucionar un ecosistema de microservicios y de CLIs implementados en Go. Desarrollar y mantener scripts de automatizacion en Python para el despliegue de aplicaciones.
• Analisis tecnico de las tareas a realizar.
• Refactorizacion y mejora continua del codigo.
• Implementacion de flujos basados en GitHub Actions Evolucion de flujos de despliegue en Argo Workflows
• Mejora y rediseno de los custom charts de Kubernetes de la compania.
• Operar en clusters basados en Kubernetes (OCP, AKS, etc.)
• Apoyar al equipo de soporte en las incidencias que escalen.
• Colaborar estrechamente con los equipos de desarrollo (stakeholders) para entender los requisitos de cada funcionalidad y validarla.

Requisitos deseados:
• Graduado en Ingenieria informatica (o equivalente).
• Graduado en Formacion Profesional Superior o Medio en Informatica.
• Experiencia en GO.
• Amplia experiencia en el despliegue y gestion de workloads de Kubernetes.
• Valorable conocimiento en herramientas como Prometheus y Grafana

Competencias personales:
• Trabajo en equipo.
• Habilidades de comunicacion, favoreciendo dinamicas que permitan el flujo de conocimiento, con interes tanto en aprender como en ensenar.
• Proactividad en la busqueda de nuevas soluciones y mejoras.

Que ofrecemos:

Conciliacion y Flexibilidad: Posibilidad de trabajar desde casa hibrido/remoto, jornadas flexibles y viernes intensivos.

Formacion y Desarrollo: Plan personalizado, programas formativos.

Beneficios Sociales: Cheques comida, seguro vida, apoyo teletrabajo.

Retribucion Flexible: Ajustada a tus necesidades (seguro medico, guarderia, formacion, otros).

Paquete de Reubicacion (si aplica): Apoyo economico, asesoramiento, patrocinio visas.

Programa de Recomendaciones.

Programa de Bienestar: Nutricion, Fisica, Mental. Descuentos con Gympass, actividades deportivas, charlas, clases y asesoria con expertos, descuento en deportes, bienestar y salud mental, ademas de servicio de apoyo psicologico gratuito.

Vida en GFT: Oficinas inteligentes, eventos, permios de valores, charlas inspiradoras.

Cultura corporativa internacional.

En GFT consideramos que la diversidad es uno de nuestros pilares fundamentales y promovemos un entorno de trabajo inclusivo basado en la cooperacion y el respeto mutuo. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades a todas las personas sin tener en cuenta su raza, origen cultural, sexo, edad, orientacion sexual, identidad de genero, discapacidad o creencias religiosas. GFT dispone y ha registrado un Plan de Igualdad que recoge las medidas a adoptar con el objetivo de alcanzar en la empresa la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres y a eliminar, si es que la hay, la discriminacion por razon de sexo.

Unete a nuestro equipo global!
